{"step_by_step_thinking": "The metastasis of oral cancer is a complex process that involves the detachment of cells from the tumor tissue, their regulation, motility, invasion, proliferation, and evasion. This can occur through different routes. Direct extension refers to the spread of cancer cells to nearby tissues. Lymphatic spread refers to the spread of cancer cells through the lymphatic system, which is a network of vessels that carry a clear fluid called lymph towards the heart. Blood vessels spread refers to the spread of cancer cells through the bloodstream. Aspiration of tumor cells refers to the spread of cancer cells through the inhalation of tumor cells into the respiratory tract. According to the documents, the metastasis of oral cancer often involves the lymphatic system or blood vessels.", "answer_choice": "B. Lymphatics"}
